metadata.description: The shared Log Analytics workspace Id
The shared Azure Container Registry Id
The shared Azure Container Registry Private Endopoint Id

The application instance id helps to generate a unique application instance identifier for multiple instances of the same application. This number is also going to be used to derive its adjacent resources details when needed
The AKS cluster Internal Load Balancer Ip Address
The regional network spoke VNet Resource ID that the cluster will be joined to
Azure AD Group in the identified tenant that will be granted the highly privileged cluster-admin role.
Your AKS control plane Cluster API authentication tenant
The certificate data for app gateway TLS termination. It is base64
The base 64 encoded AKS Ingress Controller public certificate (as .crt or .cer) to be stored in Azure Key Vault as secret and referenced by Azure Application Gateway as a trusted root certificate.

IP ranges authorized to contact the Kubernetes API server. Passing an empty array will result in no IP restrictions. If any are provided, remember to also provide the public IP of the egress Azure Firewall otherwise your nodes will not be able to talk to the API server (e.g. Flux).
AKS Service, Node Pool, and supporting services (KeyVault, App Gateway, etc) region. This needs to be the same region as the vnet provided in these parameters.

resources.name: [variables('clusterControlPlaneIdentityName')]
resources.comments: The control plane identity used by the cluster. Used for networking access (VNET joining and DNS updating)

resources.name: mi-appgateway-frontend
resources.comments: User Managed Identity that App Gateway is assigned. Used for Azure Key Vault Access.

resources.name: podmi-ingress-controller
resources.comments: User Managed Identity for the cluster's ingress controller pods. Used for Azure Key Vault Access.

resources.name: [concat('Microsoft.Authorization/', guid(concat(resourceGroup().id), variables('readerRole')))]
resources.comments: Grant the AKS cluster ingress controller pod managed identity with reader role permissions over Key Vault; paired with the Access Policy, this allows our ingress controller to pull certificates.

resources.name: [variables('akvPrivateDnsZonesName')]
resources.comments: Enabling Azure Key Vault Private Link support.

resources.name: [concat('to_', variables('vnetName'))]
resources.comments: Enabling Azure Key Vault Private Link on cluster vnet.

resources.name: [concat('privatelink.azurecr.io/to_', variables('vnetName'))]
resources.comments: Enabling cluster vnet private zone DNS lookup - used by cluster vnet for direct DNS queries (ones not proxied via the hub).

properties.description: Allows cluster identity to join the nodepool vmss resources to this subnet.
Allows cluster identity to join load balancers (ingress resources) to this subnet.

resources.name: [guid(resourceGroup().id)]
resources.comments: It is required to grant the AKS cluster with Virtual Machine Contributor role permissions over the cluster infrastructure resource group to work with Managed Identities and aad-pod-identity. Otherwise MIC component fails while attempting to update MSI on VMSS cluster nodes

properties.description: Allows cluster identity to pull container images from this container registry.

resources.name: [concat('Microsoft.Authorization/', guid(resourceId('Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters', variables('clusterName')), 'omsagent', variables('monitoringMetricsPublisherRole')))]
resources.comments: Grant the OMS Agent's Managed Identity the metrics publisher role to push alerts

resources.name: [concat('Node CPU utilization high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-1')]

properties.description: Node CPU utilization across the cluster.

resources.name: [concat('Node working set memory utilization high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-2')]

properties.description: Node working set memory utilization across the cluster.

resources.name: [concat('Jobs completed more than 6 hours ago for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-11')]

properties.description: This alert monitors completed jobs (more than 6 hours ago).

resources.name: [concat('Container CPU usage high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-9')]

properties.description: This alert monitors container CPU utilization.

resources.name: [concat('Container working set memory usage high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-10')]

properties.description: This alert monitors container working set memory utilization.

resources.name: [concat('Pods in failed state for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-4')]

properties.description: This alert monitors disk usage for all nodes and storage devices.

resources.name: [concat('Nodes in not ready status for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-3')]
[concat('Containers getting OOM killed for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-6')]

properties.description: This alert monitors number of containers killed due to out of memory (OOM) error.

resources.name: [concat('Persistent volume usage high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-18')]

properties.description: This alert monitors persistent volume utilization.

resources.name: [concat('Pods not in ready state for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-8')]

properties.description: This alert monitors for excessive pods not in the ready state.
This alert monitors number of containers restarting across the cluster.

resources.name: [concat('podmi-ingress-controller', '/Microsoft.Authorization/', guid(concat(resourceGroup().id), variables('managedIdentityOperatorRole')))]
resources.comments: Grant the AKS cluster with Manage Identity Operator role permissions over the managed identity used for the ingress controller.  Allows it to be assigned to the underlying VMSS.

resources.name: [variables('policyAssignmentNameAKSLinuxRestrictive')]
resources.comments: Applying the 'AKS Linux Restrictive' policy to the resource group

resources.name: [variables('policyAssignmentNameEnforceHttpsIngress')]
resources.comments: Applying the 'Enforce HTTPS ingress in Kubernetes cluster' policy to the resource group.

resources.name: [variables('policyAssignmentNameEnforceInternalLoadBalancers')]
resources.comments: Applying the 'Enforce internal load balancers in Kubernetes cluster' policy to the resource group.

resources.name: [variables('policyAssignmentNameRoRootFilesystem')]
resources.comments: Applying the 'Kubernetes cluster containers should run with a read only root file system' policy to the resource group.

resources.name: [variables('policyAssignmentNameEnforceResourceLimits')]
resources.comments: Applying the 'Container Images Resource Limits' policy at the resource group level.

resources.name: [variables('policyAssignmentNameEnforceImageSource')]
resources.comments: Applying the 'Allowed Container Images' regex policy at the resource group level. If all images are pull into your ARC instance as described in these instructions you can remove the docker.io entries.
